data.title: Famous Deaths on May 19
data.meta_description: Famous deaths for the 19th of May. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals died throughout history on May 19.
data.text:
Alcuin of York, English scholar, dies in Tours France at 69

Dunstan, English Archbishop of Canterbury, Abbot of Glastonbury Abbey, illustrator and silversmith (restored monastic life after era of Viking raids), dies at about 79 (canonized 1029)

Stephen, Count of Blois (b. c. 1045)

Vladimir Monomakh, Russian prince (b. 1053)

Celestine V [Pietro del Murrone], Pope (1294), dies

Ivo of Kermartin, Catholic saint and patron of Brittany, dies at 49

Prince Louis, Count of Évreux, son of King Philip III of France, dies at 43

Dmitri Donskoi, Grand Prince of Muscovy (b. 1350)

Emperor Go-Kashiwabara, 104th Emperor of Japan (1500-26), dies at 63

Jan Łaski, Polish statesman and diplomat (b. 1456)

Anne Boleyn

Queen of England (1533-36), second wife of Henry VIII, beheaded at the Tower of London on charges of adultery, incest and treason, at between age 28 to 35

Juan Bautista de Toledo, Spanish architect (El Escorial), dies (b. c. 1515)

Costanzo Porta, Italian composer

Thomas Sanchez, Spanish theologian (b. 1550)

Katharina Henot, German postmaster (1st female postmaster in Germany), burnt at the stake in Cologne for being a witch (b. 1570) [1]

Isaac Beeckman, Dutch scientist and philosopher, dies at 48

Sebastian Vrancx, Flemish painter (captain of vigilante), dies

Carel Reyniersz, Dutch colonial administrator and Governor-General of the Dutch East Indies (1650-53), dies at 48

Charles Montagu, 1st Earl of Halifax, English poet and statesman, dies at 54

Button Gwinnett, British-born American politician, and signer of the Declaration of Independence,dies from wounds incurred in a duel with rival Lachlan McIntosh at 42

John Stanley, English blind composer and organist, dies at 74

James Boswell, Scottish biographer of Samuel Johnson and diarist, dies at 54

1795 Josiah Bartlett, American physician and statesman (signed US Declaration of Independence), dies at 65

William Byron, 5th Baron Byron, English nobleman and politician, dies at 75

French Bosbeeck, veterinarian/robber, hanged

Herman Hendrik Vitringa, Dutch Federalist politician (National Meetings), dies at 43

Camille Jordan, French politician (b. 1771)

Claude Henri de Rouvroy, Comte de Saint-Simon, French political philosopher (b. 1760)

Maria EJ Versfelt, mistress of general Moreau/marshal Ney, dies at 68

Nathaniel Hawthorne

American author (House of 7 Gables, The Scarlet Letter), dies at 59

Benjamin Guinness, Irish brewer and philanthropist, dies at 69

Johan Hendrik van Dale, Dutch schoolmaster and lexicographer(Van Dale's Great Dictionary of the Dutch Language), dies of smallpox at 44

Guillaume Groen van Prinsterer, Dutch statesman and historian, dies at 74

Peter W. Barlow, English engineer (b. 1809)

Hermann Hirschboch, German composer and music critic, dies at 76

Gus Kempis, South African cricketer (South Africa's 1st Test), dies of fever at 24

Jose Marti y Perez, Cuban poet (Versos sencillos) essayist and politician (fought for independence from Spain), dies fighting the Battle of Dos Rios at 42

William Gladstone

Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (Liberal: 1868-74, 1880-86, 1892-94), dies of heart failure at 88

Marthinus Wessels Pretorius, 1st president of the Republic South Africa, dies at 81

Arthur Shrewsbury, English cricket batsman (23 Tests [7 captain]; 1277 runs @ 35 47; Nottinghamshire), dies at 47

Auguste Molinier, French historian (b. 1851)

1904 Jamsetji Tata, Indian pioneer industrialist (Tata Group), dies at 65

Gabriel Dumont, Metis political and military leader (Louis Riel’s commander during North-West rebellion against Canadian government), dies at 68

Benjamin Baker

English civil engineer who designed the bridge over the Firth of Forth, Scotland and the London underground, dies at 67

Bolesław Prus, Polish writer (The Outpost), dies at 64

1912 Eduard Adolf Strasburger, German botanist who discovered that the nucleus of plant cells divides during cell division, dies at 68

Bob Ferguson, Scottish golfer (British Open 1880, 81, 82), dies at 69

1915 John Simpson Kirkpatrick stretcher bearer with the Australian and New Zealand Army Corps at Gallipoli during World War I (b. 1892)

Belva Ann Lockwood, American attorney (1st woman to argue before the US Supreme Court, 1879), dies at 86

Gervais Raoul Lufbery, French-American World War I fighter pilot and flying ace, dies at 33

Edward Douglass White, American politician and jurist (9th Chief Justice of the United States), dies at 75

Heinrich Quincke, German internist and surgeon (postural drainage), dies at 79

Billy Zulch, cricketer (South African batsman scored 2 Test centuries), dies

Viking Eggeling, Swedish artist/filmmaker (Symphonie Diagonale), dies at 44

Henry F. Gilbert, American composer, and folk song collector, dies at 59

1928 Max Scheler, German philosopher, dies at 53

Charles Martin Tornow Loeffler, German-American violinist and composer, dies at 74

T. E. Lawrence

British author, soldier and diplomat famous for his liaison role in Arabia during WWI, dies at 46, in a motorcycle accident in Dorset, England

Nicoline Magdalene Roll Anker, Norwegian author (Enken), dies at 69

Kristjan Raud, Estonian painter and one of the founders of the Estonian National Museum, dies at 77

Godfrey Wilson, British Anthropologist of social change and colonial problems in Africa, commits suicide as a conscientious objector in WW II

Philipp Bouhler, German nazi leader (b. 1889)

Booth Tarkington, American novelist (The Magnificent Ambersons) and playwright, dies at 76

Damaso Berenguer, Spanish soldier and politician (122nd Prime Minister of Spain), dies at 79

Aart A. van Schelven, Dutch church historian (Willem of Orange), dies at 73

Charles Ives

American composer (Unanswered Question), dies at 79

Archie Scott-Brown, English race car driver (b. 1927)

1958 Bruno Stürmer, German conductor, composer and educator dies at 65

Ronald Colman

British actor (Lost Horizon, The Prisoner of Zenda, Phantom Shot), dies at 67

Joe Howard, American vaudeville, Broadway, and television singer (Gay Nineties Revue), and songwriter ("Hello Ma Baby"), dies at 91

Gabriele Münter, German expressionist painter

Maria Dabrowska, Polish writer (Nights and Days), dies at 75

Tortoise, reportedly given to Tonga's King by Captain James Cook in 1773, dies at around 193

Elmo Hope, American bebop jazz pianist, composer, and arranger, dies of heart failure at 43

Coleman Hawkins, American jazz musician who virtually created tenor saxophone for jazz, dies at 64

Ray Schalk, American Baseball Hall of Fame catcher (World Series 1917; Chicago White Sox) and manager (Chicago White Sox 1927-28), dies from cancer at 78

1970 Tadeusz Breza, Polish writer (The Bronze Gate), dies at 64

Bernard Wagenaar, Dutch-American composer (3 Songs for Chinese), dies at 76

Ogden Nash

American humorous poet (I'm a Stranger Here Myself, Masquerade Party), dies at 68 [1]

Titanic Thompson, American gambler and hustler, dies at 80

George Gladstone, cricketer (one Test WI v England 1930), dies

Jean Rey, Belgian politician (President of the European Commission 1967-70), dies at 80

Bill Holland, American auto racer (Indianapolis 500 1949; runner-up 1947, 48, 50), dies at 76

1984 John Betjeman, poet (Mount Zion) and English Poet Laureate (1972-1984), dies at 77

Jimmy Lyons, American jazz saxophonist and composer (Cecil Taylor), dies of lung cancer at 54

James Tiptree Jr. [Alice Sheldon], American sci-fi author (Byte Beautiful), dies at 71

Virginia Farmer, actress (Cyrano de Bergerac), dies at 90

Abel Herzberg, Russian-Dutch Jewish lawyer (Eichmann in Jerusalem), dies at 95

1989 Anton Diffring [Alfred Pollack], German character actor (Assignment Vienna), dies of cancer at 72

1989 Robert Webber, American actor (12 Angry Men, Moonlighting, 79 Park Avenue), dies of Lou Gehrig's disease at 64

Douglas L. Mays, English cartoonist (Punch), dies at 90

1991 Rini Otte, Dutch actress (Ergens in Nederland), dies at 74

Hans Vogt, German composer, dies at 81

Nemesio Antunes, Chilean painter, dies at 75

1993 Ranga Sohoni, Indian cricket all-rounder (4 Tests, top score 29 no, 2 wickets), dies from a heart attack at 75

1993 Richard Murphy, director (3 Stripes in the Sun), dies of stroke at 81

1993 S W Sohoni, cricketer (4 Tests for India), dies

Henry Morgan, American comedian and TV panelist (I've Got a Secret; Arena), dies of lung cancer at 79

Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

American 1st lady (1961-63), dies of cancer at 64

1994 Jacques Ellul, French writer and philosopher, dies at 82

1994 Luis Ocaña, Spanish road cyclist (Tour de France 1973; Vuelta a España 1970), commits suicide at 48

Robert S. Dietz, American geophysicist who proposed a theory of seafloor spreading in 1961, dies at 80

Frank Carlson, American jazz and session drummer (Woody Herman, 1937-42 - "The Golden Wedding"), dies at 82

1996 Giovanni "John" Beradino, American MLB infielder (St. Louis Browns, Cleveland Indians) and actor (General Hospital), dies from pancreatic cancer at 79

1996 Margaret Rawlings, British actress (Roman Holiday), dies at 89

Millie, dog of US President George H. W. Bush (Millie's Book), dies at 12

(Edwin) "Ted" Astley, British arranger, bandleader, and film and television composer (The Mouse That Roared; The Saint), dies at 76

1998 Dorothy Donegan, American boogie-woogie, swing jazz, and classical pianist, and vocalist, dies of cancer at 76

1998 Sōsuke Uno, Japanese prime minister (b. 1922)

James Blades, British classical percussionist, and educator, dies at 97

1999 Jonathan "Candy" Candido, American actor and radio performer (Peter Pan; The Great Mouse Detective), dies at 85

Larry Lamb, British newspaper editor (The Sun, 1969-72 and 1975-81; Daily Express, 1983-86; The Australian, 1991-92), dies at 70

2000 Yevgeny Khrunov, Soviet cosmonaut, dies at 66

Mike Sammes, British arranger, session, pop and easy-listening vocalist (The Mike Sammes Singers; Disneyland; The Beatles - "I Am The Walrus", "Good Night"; Olivia Newton-John - "Let Me Be There"), dies at 73

2001 Susannah McCorkle, American singer (b. 1946)

John Gorton, Australian politician, 19th Prime Minister of Australia (1968-71), dies at 90

2002 Walter Lord, American author (A Night to Remember), dies at 84

Mary Dresselhuys, Dutch stage and screen actress, dies at 97

Henry Corden, American actor and voice artist (b. 1921)

Freddie Garrity, English pop singer (Freddie and the Dreamers - "I'm Telling You Now"), dies at 69

Bernard Blaut, Polish soccer midfielder (36 caps; KP Legia Warsaw, FC Metz) and manager (UAE), dies at 67

2007 Dean Eyre, New Zealand politician (b. 1914)

George Huntington Hartford II, American heir (A&P), dies at 97

2008 Vijay Tendulkar, Indian playwright, (b. 1928)

Herbert York, American physicist (b. 1921)

2009 Nicholas Maw, British composer, dies at 73

2009 Robert F. Furchgott, American pharmacologist (co-winner Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, 1998), and educator, dies at 92

Garret FitzGerald, Irish politician and 8th Taoiseach of Ireland (Fine Gael: 1981-87), dies at 85

2011 Kathy Kirby, English singer (Secret Love), dies at 72

2011 Phyllis Avery, American actress (Ruby Gentry, George Gobel Show, Mr Novak), dies at 88

Bob Boozer, College/Basketball Hall of Fame forward (Olympic gold 1960), dies of a brain aneurysm at 75

Jack Brabham, Australian auto racer and team owner (World F1 champion 1959, 60, 66 [only man to win F1 C'ship driving one of his own cars]), dies of liver disease at 88

2014 Michael Aldrich, British inventor (Online shopping), dies at 72

2014 Sante Kimes 'Dragon Lady', American convicted con artist and murderess, dies at 79

(Angus) "Alan" Young, British-Canadian-American actor (Mister Ed - "Wilbur"), and voice actor (Scrooge McDuck), dies of natural causes at 96

2016 Morley Safer, Canadian-American TV newscaster (60 Minutes), dies at 84

Alfred Janson, Norwegian jazz and classical pianist and composer (Passacaglia Vendetta; Variations over Variations on a Norwegian Folk Tune), dies at 82

Richard Anuszkiewicz, American artist 'new wizard of op', dies at 89

Abubakar Shekau, Nigerian Islamist militant (leader of Boko Haram), dies detonating a suicide vest

2021 Alix Dobkin, American folk and feminist singer-songwriter (Lavender Jane Loves Women), dies of a brain aneurysm and stroke at 80

2021 Joey Cathcart, American rock guitarist (Nelson - "Love & Affection"), dies of brain cancer at 53

2021 Lee Evans, American athlete (Olympic gold men's 400m, 4x400m relay 1968), dies from stroke complications at 74

Andy Rourke British rock bassist (The Smiths - "This Charming Man"; "Ask"), dies of pancreatic cancer at 59

2023 Brian Booth, Australian cricket batsman (29 Tests @ 42.21, 5 x 100s, 10 x 50s; NSW), dies at 89

2023 Martin Amis, British novelist (London Fields; The Rachel Papers), dies of esophageal cancer at 73

2023 Pete Brown, British musician and lyricist (Cream - "I Feel Free"; "White Room"; "Sunshine of Your Love"), dies at 82 [1]

Ebrahim Raisi, Iranian jurist and President of Iran (2021-24), dies in a helicopter crash at 63

2024 Jim Otto, American Pro Football HOF center (AFL C'ship 1967; 9 × First-team All-AFL & AFL All-Star; 3 x Pro Bowl; Oakland Raiders), dies at 86

May 19 Highlights
